title: What is the best way to write a ballad? - Quora

response.answer_text: Image: sk: Homemade almond extract and cherry pit vodka | CC BY-ND 2.0 Judging by the words of popular ballads, it helps to be rollicking drunk. One associates drinking songs with beer, but a jug of applejack will do. So would a wee drap of single malt scotch. The same goes for brandy and tequila. Legend has it that Janis Joplin wrote her best songs after swigs of Southern Comfort. When you’re all set, hide your car keys, pour yourself a shot and listen to inspirational music to get in the mood. My former in-laws lived below the Mason-Dixon line, and liked songs like, “The year that Clayton Delaney died.” I’m partial to AC/DCs “Have a drink on me.” Whatever works for you should do it. The rest is easy: Grab a pencil and paper and channel those bat-winged phantoms flapping through the damp corridors of your brain. Good luck in your career as a balladeer.

Mr. songwriter :) thanks for asking me , i am flattered. i have composed a few power ballads , my inspiration came from life events that truly affected me . if you have experienced a bad break-up ,that is one direction to go ..reach down in your hurting heart but also tap into your anger , angst, sleepless nights , resentment then write the words FIRST ..the melody will follow and the beat . express yourself ,and how you really felt . another power ballads i wrote once was about the plight of the rainforests and mankind how they are being exploited every day with no end in sight . again, lyrics 1st and melody to go with it . a great power ballads that you might know i can think of is “ you give love a bad name “ - BonJovi if i remember right. obviously written about a relationship that turned crappy and the guy is down on women and love for the moment. hope i have given you some insight ,maybe helpful direction.
